name: AutoScalingGroup
description: The AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup type creates an Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: AvailabilityZones
properties.description: Contains a list of availability zones for the group.

properties.name: Cooldown
properties.description: The number of seconds after a scaling activity is completed before any further scaling activities can start.

properties.name: DesiredCapacity
properties.description: Specifies the desired capacity for the Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: HealthCheckGracePeriod
properties.description: The length of time in seconds after a new EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.

properties.name: HealthCheckType
properties.description: The service you want the health status from, Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancer. Valid values are EC2 or ELB.

properties.name: InstanceId
properties.description: The ID of the Amazon EC2 instance you want to use to create the Auto Scaling group. Use this property if you want to create an Auto Scaling group that uses an existing Amazon EC2 instance instead of a launch configuration.

properties.name: LaunchConfigurationName
properties.description: Specifies the name of the associated AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration.

properties.name: LoadBalancerNames
properties.description: A list of load balancers associated with this Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: MaxSize
properties.description: The maximum size of the Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: MetricsCollection
properties.description: Enables the monitoring of group metrics of an Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: MinSize
properties.description: The minimum size of the Auto Scaling group.

properties.name: NotificationConfigurations
properties.description: An embedded property that configures an Auto Scaling group to send notifications when specified events take place.

properties.name: PlacementGroup
properties.description: The name of an existing cluster placement group into which you want to launch your instances. A placement group is a logical grouping of instances within a single Availability Zone. You cannot specify multiple Availability Zones and a placement group.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The tags you want to attach to this resource.

properties.name: TerminationPolicies
properties.description: A policy or a list of policies that are used to select the instances to terminate. The policies are executed in the order that you list them.

properties.name: VPCZoneIdentifier
properties.description: A list of subnet identifiers of Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPCs).
